name: Calcarea fluorica
Relationship: Mangifera indica (varicose veins).Compare: Con.; Lapis; Baryt. mur.; Hecla.; Rhus; Cacodylate of Soda (Tumors).Calc-st-sula. (acts as an hemostatic and absorptive in uterine myoma).

Eyes: Flickering and sparks before the eyes, spots on the cornea; conjunctivitis; cataract
Stomach: Weakness and daintiness of appetite, nausea and distress after eating in young children who are overtaxed by studies
ACUTE INDIGESTION FROM FATIGUE and brain-fag; much flatulence
Fissure of the anus, and intensely sore crack near the lower end of the bowel
Itching of anus as from pin-worms
Internal or blind piles frequently, with pain in back, generally far down on the sacrum, and constipation
Mouth: Induration of the tongue, hardening after inflammation
Gum-boils, with hard swelling on the jaw
Unnatural looseness of the teeth, with or without pain; teeth become loose in their sockets
Toothache, with pain if any food touches the tooth
Cracked appearance of the tongue, with or without pain
Respiratory: Cough with expectoration of tiny lumps of yellow mucus, with tickling sensation and irritation on lying down
Head: Creaking noise in head
Hard excrescences on the scalp
Ulcers on the scalp with callous, hard edges
Blood-tumors of newborn infants
Face: Hard swelling on the cheek, with pain or toothache, hard swelling on jaw bone
Throat: Follicular sore throat; plugs of mucus are continually forming in the crypts of the tonsils
Relaxed uvula, tickling referred to larynx
Pain and burning in throat; better by warm drinks; worse, cold drinks
Nose: Cold in the head; stuffy cold; dry coryza; ozaena
Copious, offensive, thick, greenish, lumpy, yellow nasal catarrh
Atrophic rhinitis, especially if crusts are prominent
Neck and Back: Chronic LUMBAGO; aggravated on beginning to move, and ameliorated on continued motion
Pain lower part of back, with burning
RACHITIC ENLARGEMENT OF FEMUR IN INFANTS
Ears: Calcareous deposits on tympanum; sclerosis of ossicula and petrous portion of temporal bone, with deafness, ringing and roaring
Mind: Great depression; groundless fears of financial ruin
Sleep: Vivid dreams, with sense of impending danger
Skin: Indolent, fistulous ulcers, secreting thick, yellow pus
Knots, kernels, hardened glands in the female breast
SWELLINGS OR INDURATED ENLARGEMENTS having their seat in the fasciae and capsular ligaments of joints, or in the tendons
Hard, elevated edges of ulcer, surrounding skin purple and swollen
Fissures or cracks in the palms of the hands, or hard skin
Extremities: Gouty enlargements of the joints of the fingers
Ganglia or encysted tumors at the back of the wrist

details: A powerful tissue remedy for hard, stony glands, varicose and enlarged veins, and malnutrition of bones. Hard knots in female breast. Goitre. Congenital hereditary syphilis. INDURATION THREATENING SUPPURATION. Many cases of cataract have undoubtedly been influenced favorably by it. Congenital syphilis manifesting itself in ulceration of mouth and throat, caries and necrosis with boring pains and heat in parts. Arteriosclerosis; threatened apoplexy. Tuberculosis. Used after operations, the tendency to adhesions is reduced.
dosage: Third to twelfth trituration. A chronic remedy. Needs some time before manifesting its effects. Should not be repeated too frequently.
